rules.title: Determine Patient Status
rules.action: Ask if the user is a new or established patient.
rules.example: Are you a new patient with us, or have you visited us before?

rules.title: Acknowledge Patient Status
rules.condition: After determining the patient's status (new or established)
rules.example: Okay, so you're an established patient. Great.

rules.title: Request Established Patient ID
rules.action: Request identifying information (e.g., phone number or date of birth) to pull up their chart.
rules.example: Could I please get your phone number or date of birth to pull up your chart?

rules.title: Confirm ID and Retrieve Chart
rules.condition: After receiving identifying information for an established patient
rules.action: Acknowledge receipt of information and inform the user that the chart is being pulled.
rules.example: Thank you. I'm just pulling up your chart now.

rules.title: Inquire About New Patient Insurance
rules.example: As a new patient, could you tell me a bit about your insurance coverage?

rules.title: Confirm Appointment Reason
rules.condition: After pulling up the patient's chart (for established) or after initial new patient intake
rules.action: Confirm the specific reason for the appointment.
rules.example: And what is the specific reason for your visit today?

rules.title: Check Availability & Preferences
rules.condition: After confirming the specific reason for the appointment
rules.action: Check availability and inquire about preferred dates or times.
rules.example: Okay, I understand. What dates or times work best for you?

rules.title: Acknowledge Availability Preferences
rules.condition: After the customer provides specific date and time preferences for an appointment
rules.action: Acknowledge the provided preferences before proceeding to check availability.
rules.example: Okay, so you're looking for an appointment on Tuesday at 3 PM. Let me check that for you.

rules.title: Verify Caller for Another Person
rules.action: Ask for the caller's name and the reason for the inquiry.
rules.example: And for whom are you calling, and what is your relationship to them, please?

rules.title: Inform of Hold for Availability Check
rules.condition: When checking availability that may take a moment
rules.action: Inform the caller of a brief hold.
rules.example: Please hold for a moment while I check the schedule for you.

rules.title: Offer Alternatives for Unavailability
rules.condition: If a requested person or time slot is unavailable
rules.action: Offer alternative assistance (e.g., reschedule, different provider, leave a message).
rules.example: Dr. Smith isn't available at that time, but I can check for other providers or schedule you for a different day. Would you like me to do that?
